text:
Anyone got any exciting 2021 plans/intentions/goals when it comes to betting? 

Personally I am looking to get flumine in a solid state as I am half way to migrating all my strategies to it. Also looking to roll my own container orchestration / auto scaling cluster / API so I can better monitor / spin up strategies and backtest pipelines

elements.text: Anyone got any exciting 2021 plans/intentions/goals when it comes to betting?

Personally I am looking to get flumine in a solid state as I am half way to migrating all my strategies to it. Also looking to roll my own container orchestration / auto scaling cluster / API so I can better monitor / spin up strategies and backtest pipelines

text: My plan is for my algo to not lose money when I turn it on at some point in 2021

elements.text: My plan is for my algo to not lose money when I turn it on at some point in 2021

text: <@U4H19D1D2> thanks alot for flumine, I had started something similar but your expertise and superior coding made flumine a must have :+1: Multiple beers coming your way next time we cross paths :beer:

text: Biggest one for me: focusing on optimal execution. Probably forfeiting a significant portion of pnl by not looking at the best moment to execute when signals persist for a longer period.

text: Number one goal for next year is to stay in profit and test new ideas. The last quarter for me has been excellent and Id like to develop those ideas whilst being more aggressive. Above all; still enjoy the challenge :grinning:

text: Get my first profitable strategy :wink: And tbh, if i can contribute to something to basic things for others more than happy to. Flumine has really been a saver into understanding where my ideas would break

text: <@UBS7QANF3> before mentoring, i think maybe getting to some sport modelling for real would be good. happy to find something to contribute (if I can) to make sure it doesn't look like there's a bunch of newbies leeching from the more experienced people.

text: I mean, in soccer, there are only a bunch of papers most of which get you worse results than Nate Silver's model :stuck_out_tongue_winking_eye:

text: Congrats Alessio! Curious, what approach are you taking? Generating models from historical football data, statistical arbitrage, etc?

elements.text: Congrats Alessio! Curious, what approach are you taking? Generating models from historical football data, statistical arbitrage, etc?

text: Personally working on statistical arbitrage within soccer myself.

elements.text: Personally working on statistical arbitrage within soccer myself.

text: For now, i am looking at two things: low liqudity markets where betfair goes out of sync with reality and historical data prediction to see when a "sure bet" will generate during certain markets

elements.text: For now, i am looking at two things: low liqudity markets where betfair goes out of sync with reality and historical data prediction to see when a "sure bet" will generate during certain markets

text: So January 1 is when we (there are 2 of us) wind up bet sizes to (hopefully) sort that out. It's more maths than hope, but on a daily/weekly basis there is a lot of luck

text: My aim is also to turn profitable in 2021! And to keep learning and improving my knowledge, skills and strategies. Hopefully I will be able to help others in this community as well, as it has been an essential resource for me as well as a source of inspiration. Thanks to the guys who made it and to everyone for the debates and long may your automated profits continue :grin:
